page.title: 07Housing on Todmorden Moor
page.content: The{housing}of the area is very scattered. Originally most of the houses would have been farmhouses but these have more recently been developed as private residences. The moor is criss-crossed by three or four isolated roads and bounded by the Bacup Road from Todmorden to Sharneyford on one side and the Burnley Road from Todmorden to Cliviger on the other side. Due to the steep sided nature of both these valleys any development has been a {ribbon development}along the narrow valley bottoms. The only centres of population are{Sharneyford}on the Bacup Road and{Cornholme}on the Burnley Road. Sharneyford has one small primary school which is in the Lancashire education authority and Cornholme also has a primary school in the Calderdale education authority.
